JobTitle: Low Observables RCS Analysis Engineer / Orlando FL
JobFullDesc: Description:Lockheed Martin is seeking a Signature Management/Low Observables (LO) lead Engineer experienced in the development of a complex system responsible for the analysis, integration, testing, and verification activities to ensure system signature performance  are achieved. The LO Engineer will perform analysis of vehicle and component RCS predicted performance to include LO performance trade studies during the program  phase. The LO Engineer will perform roll-ups of component data and will coordinate performance specification allocations to both internal designs and to supplier designs. During system integration and design, measured data will be analyzed for LO design verification.Relocation:  Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting position.  The Locale: Orlando is a city in the Central Florida area. This region is a great place to live and to raise a family.  Central Florida offers lots of attractive residential housing options. The Greater Orlando metropolitan area is the sixth largest metro area in the southeastern United States. The climate here is warm and sunny all year long for the most part.  Orlando is home to Walt Disney World, Universal Studios Florida, and SeaWorld.  Orlando is also home to the second largest University in the US, the University of Central Florida (UCF).  Where can you get to from Orlando?  Orlando is about an hour's drive from Cocoa Beach and the "Space Coast" to include NASA and the Kennedy Space Center.  Tampa is about 1.5 hours from Orlando.  West Palm Beach is about 2.5 hours to the south and Jacksonville is about 2 hours to the northeast.   Atlanta, GA is 6 hours to the northwest.Basic Qualifications:Candidate must be a U.S. Citizen and have an Active DoD Secret clearance.Candidate must have experience with the following Low Observable Engineering assignments:-Perform  analyses/trade studies for material selection, platform configuration and RF phenomenology. -Demonstrate knowledge, or experience, ranging from RF to MMW scattering phenomena. -Strong CAD skills (CATIA or Pro-E preferred) required. -Demonstrated experience w/ X-Patch and SENTRI.-Demonstrate knowledge and/or experience with complex low observable  and material technologies.Desired Skills:-Perform verification of platform low observable characteristics via comprehensive RCS testing. -Prior experience with system RCS , analysis, and testing through the program lifecycle. -Prior experience with utilizing Xpatch and method of moments analysis codes for RCS predictions.-Experience assuring that system IR and RF signatures are defined, minimized, and controlled through the entire development process. -Experience assuring that low signature  solutions are coordinated and managed with program disciplines and suppliers. -Demonstrate experience with radar absorbing material, paints, seals, and their corrosion resistant properties. -A Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics is desired. -Active or ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret clearance.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
